# Task: Create Documentation


## Objective
Create comprehensive user documentation including README, API documentation, and usage examples.

## Rules Compliance
Follow documentation standards, ensure all features are documented, and provide clear examples.

## Context
Good documentation is essential for user adoption and maintenance. Documentation should cover installation, usage, API reference, and troubleshooting.

## Requirements
- Update README with installation and quick start guide
- Create API documentation for all public interfaces
- Add usage examples for common scenarios
- Document configuration options
- Create troubleshooting guide

## Implementation Steps

### 1. Update README
Write clear installation instructions, quick start guide, and feature overview.

### 2. API Documentation
Document all public interfaces with parameters, return values, and examples.

### 3. Usage Examples
Create practical examples demonstrating common use cases.

## Definition of Done
- [ ] README updated with installation and quick start
- [ ] API documentation complete for all public interfaces

## Testing
- Documentation reviewed for accuracy
- All examples execute correctly
- No broken links
- Documentation covers all features

## Completion Checklist
- [ ] All requirements met
- [ ] Self-review completed
- [ ] Peer review of documentation

## Notes
Good documentation reduces support burden and improves user experience. Invest time in clear, comprehensive docs.
